lead_paragraph: Dwyane Wade had 25 points and 9 assists and the Miami Heat moved a step from its closest pursuers in the Eastern Conference playoff race on Saturday by beating the visiting Philadelphia 76ers, 97-91. Jermaine O’Neal finished with 17 points and 10 rebounds in his second game withMiami; Udonis Haslem added 13 points and 10 rebounds and Jamario Moon had 12 points. Andre Miller had 30 points for Philadelphia, which has lost three in a row for the first time since December.
